dialogue.message: Hi, how are you doing?
Hello again. I'm here to assist you. Can you tell me more details about the kind of movie you are looking for? Where you'll be watching? Who with? etc...
Yeah, sure. I'll be watching at home with a couple of mates and i'm not sure what I want to watch. Any suggestions?
Perhaps we can find a genre first. How about a war film or perhaps a film about aliens or maybe a superhero film?
Actually a war film sounds good actually. My friends will like that I'm sure?
What streaming platforms do you have and what war are you most interested in?
I torrent everything so I can watch anything at, all. How about a Vietnam film. I've seen Apocalypse now before. So not that.

OK, I've got two suggestions for you. Firstly a classic Vietnam war film called "Full Metal Jacket" directed by Stanley Kubrick. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0093058/ and secondly a a film called "Platoon" https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0091763/ directed by Oliver Stone. Both movies are very highly rated. Is that helpful?
Yes that is great. I've actually seen Platoon but not Full Metal Jacket so I think we'll watch that. Thanks.
Is there something that appeals to you specifically about Full Metal Jacket so I can improve my future suggestions?
Yeah, Stanley Kubrick is one of my favourite directors so I'm sure I will love it.
That's good to know. I'm glad I was able to help you. I'll be available any time you need me.
I'll definitely use again. Thanks.
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Good evening! I am interested in finding a movie to watch. I would love for it to be worthwhile of my time, so either critically acclaimed or loved by audiences or both would be amazing.

I am excited to help you narrow down your choices. What kind of emotion do you want to feel from your movies? There are many different genres such as comedy, action, and drama. Also movies from this year will be considered for Golden Globes and the Academy Awards, but past movies have been already awarded and carefully reviewed.

I would like to laugh and also hear some memorable lines. I would also like to see the characters having fun so that I can feel like I am in their shoes. But if they experience an interesting problem that would be great too!

Are you watching by yourself or with other people? Some people prefer a more relaxed movie when they are by themselves and a scary movie when they are with others so they can share the emotion together.

I would like a more relaxed movie for sure. I am destressing from work and I think watching a fun movie would help me feel better. I want it to stand the test of time, so that if I quote it other people know what I am talking about.

Would you prefer an American movie or an international film? There are many countries that provide a variety of cinematic experiences, so it would be wonderful to know if you are open to learning about different cultures or would like to immerse yourself in your own.

I think for now I would prefer to see an American film, mainly because it will be easier for me to understand the accent and not need to rely so heavily on subtitles. I am glad that they are available for pretty much any movie though!

At this time I would recommend a film like the Big Lebowski. It is a classic comedy film featuring a crime that is unlikely to happen, but the characters do certainly feel like they could exist. Many people are aware of this film and can quote it fairly easily. I would recommend checking it out! Please let me know what you think! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0118715/
I like the sound of that! It sounds like a movie that many people have heard of. I think I remember that they go bowling in it. Are there any other films with sports that you recommend?

If you would like a film featuring women and sports, A League of Their Own is a film that has received both audience and critical acclaim. Geena Davis and Tom Hanks deliver incredible performances. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0104694/
Thank you that's perfect! I am excited to watch it.
Thank you for sharing your ideas with me, I am glad I was able to help. I hope you will let me know if you need assistance in the future!
I thank you for your time!

users_mood: quotes that stand the test of time

dialogue.message: Good evening! I would love your help to decide on another Tom Hanks movie. There are so many options that it is making my head spin!

Hello, thank you so much for asking for guidance! Will you be watching on your own or with others? Could you tell me which streaming platforms you have access to? Is there perhaps a theme you would like to share as far as y our movie preferences go?

I will be watching with others because my friends are coming over for a party. I have Netflix and Prime Video. I was thinking that I would rather it be exciting and I would rather not cry during it, as he is an amazing dramatic actor but I do not want to feel depressed right now.

Tom Hanks is certainly in many films, and among the most popular are Forrest Gump and Catch Me If You Can. The former has several sad moments which lead me to not recommend it. Leonardo DiCaprio also delivers a stunning performance in the latter. It will definitely keep the energy up in your party, and there are few if any truly sad moments. It has absolutely stood the test of time. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0264464/

So you think I should see Catch Me If You Can? I have heard it has more accuracies than the average film about a real person. Steven Spielberg is also one of the best directors around. I would love to see it!

Could you tell me more about your interest in accurate film representation of history? Saving Private Ryan could be another excellent movie in your future if you prefer when movies are fairly true to history. Also have you seen the romantic comedies Tom Hanks is in already?

I've seen Saving Private Ryan and it is one of the most dramatic films, not exactly a party type film but something I would watch on my own. I love Tom Hanks romantic comedies but feel as though I've seen them all and they remind me of how old I've become!
I hope you have a fantastic night watching Catch Me If You Can! Thank you so much for reaching out and I would love to be of help in the future!
Thank you I appreciate how you helped me come to a decision more quickly than I would on my own!
Hello I'm excited to watch a movie with my kids today! Will you help me decide on what we should see?

Hi and thank you for using our service again! Please tell me what your kids have enjoyed watching in the past, and how you would like them to feel. Is there anything special coming up on the horizon for them, such as a birthday or vacation?

My kids are pretty easygoing but they do not like scary movies. PG is about as high as I've allowed them to go at this point. They prefer animated films to films with real people in them. They have seen a lot of the classic Disney movies, the most recent one of which was Moana which they enjoyed immensely. I feel like we've watched it 50 times and we sing it all the time in the car!

Thank you that helps to narrow things down! Would you be open to movies outside of the Disneyverse? Also I was wondering about whether you wanted them to sing along to songs or relax before bedtime. Which streaming platforms do you have access to?

Same platforms as before, and yes I don't mind them watching any movie as long as it is age-appropriate! I would love for them to sing along because it is my younger son's birthday coming up soon and it would be fun for them to sing along with their friends in the near future. So I guess I would love for it to be a popular movie that many children have seen already!

Matilda the Musical is currently available on Netflix! It is a powerful movie featuring amazing music that comes straight from Broadway. It received a 7.0 IMDb rating. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3447590/ Unfortunately there do not seem to be any animated films that would not cost extra to the platforms that you have at this time, such as Sing (2016).

It does look like there are children my son's age singing and dancing so that could be inspiring to my children. I would love for them to be exposed to this story since I read it as a young girl as well.
Do you think that they would enjoy the film? Have you by any chance seen the original?

We can certainly give it a try, since it gives children such autonomy. I remember thinking I would feel powerless in her situation so I would hope as my son's birthday looms near, that he is able to advocate for himself. I loved the original so much, I was so surprised that the female lead of the original film quit acting, because her performance was absolutely heartwarming.
Thank you for your time, I hope that your family enjoys the film and that it becomes part of your routine to sing along to it! I feel so fortunate that I was able to be of assistance!
Thank you, I will remember this and come back and ask you for recommendations again soon!

companion_preferences_like: popular movies that many children have seen
cultural_preferences_like: inspiring stories with singing and dancing

This is England is a movie by Shane Meadows, he has a great movie that is a psychological one called dead mans shoes, you can check it out on IMDB here: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0419677/

Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi! I will be visiting my parents at Christmas and we usually like to watch films together. Is there anything in particular you would recommend for us?

Hello! That sounds like a great idea. First of all, are there any particular genres that you know they wouldn't like to watch? This way I can make sure to recommend something perfect for your requirements.
I suppose nothing too violent, and definitely nothing that has sex scenes! Basically something that makes us feel all warm and fuzzy inside.

Oh, absolutely. It would be more than awkward to get stuck watching a sex scene with your mum and dad. Well in that case I definitely know what you don't want to see. Are there any films that stand out to you when you think of something that has made you feel good?

Haha yeah you're right about that. When I think of feel good films, I think of something like Shawshank Redemption. It has dark moments but ultimately by the end of it, you feel better about yourself and the world. Another film that makes me feel good is Paddington. It's impossible to watch that and not smile.

That's cool, so you like films from all kinds of periods by the sounds of it. How about films from before the 90's, would you be open to watching any? And if someone were to ask you who are your favourite actors, which would be the first names that pop into your head?

I don't really discriminate, there's plenty of excellent films that came out before the 90's so I would be open to recommendations from most periods. But maybe not something before the 60's. And about particular actors that I like, Tom Hanks is one of the first names that comes into my head. As well as Robin Williams (RIP). Both actors are so versatile and you know you're in good hands with them.

You're right, there are plenty of gems from the 60's, 70's, and 80's. Well, I think that I have plenty to go on here, so in that case, below is my main recommendation that I hope you and your parents like! 

I recommend Joe Versus the Volcano (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0099892/), it's a lesser-known Tom Hanks film but it fulfills all the requirements. There are elements of escapism and some wickedly funny scenes that will have you and your parents laughing. The brilliant Meg Ryan is in it too, and I'm sure you already know how good she and Hanks are together. Let me know what you think about this one after you've had a look at the trailer!
Thanks for that. It actually looks decent! Not sure how I had never heard of it before. I've seen other films with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan, and enjoyed them, so I have a feeling i'll like this too.
I'm glad to hear that, honestly. Is there anything else about it that looks good to you?

The humour seems quite dark and that's absolutely my kind of humour. I just Googled the film and saw a hilarious scene from some sort of dystopian office building, and I think this would make my dad laugh too.

Nice! Well if anything you've also made me feel good, it's always nice to know that my recommendations are appreciated. Soo if there's nothing else, I will say that it's been lovely talking with you, and I hope your family loves the film as much as I do. Speak soon.
Cheers, AI! Speak soon.

This epic sci-fi/adventure film from 2014 tells the story of a newly discovered wormhole in space that allows a team of astronauts to go where no man has gone before, as they attempt to save the people of Earth from disasters, famines, and droughts that are plaguing the planet. dialogue.message: Hi.  I need your help in selecting a film.
Hello there. I'm here to help. What genre of a movie are you in the mood for?
Since I enjoy the movie you recommended me very much. I'd love to know what other movies you'd recommend me by the same director?
Certainly. Would you please refresh my memory as to what movie you referred to?
Yes.  It's Hundred-Foot Journey.

Lasse Hallström. He's known for, "What's Eating Gilbert Grape", "Chocolat" and " A Dog's Purpose".  I highly recommended "What's Eating Gilbert Grape". https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0108550/?ref_=nm_knf_t_1 It's a great drama, and I think you'll enjoy it.
Thanks. I'll definitely check it out.
You're welcome. What's Eating Gilbert Grape was nominated and won numerous awards. I hope you'd enjoy the movie. I'd appreciated some feedback once you finish the movie.
Of course.
Let me know if there are some elements you'd prefer to avoid in the movies so that I can provide you a better service in the future. I'm excited about your feedback once you've seen the movie.
There's nothing particular I'd want to avoid. I just love a good storyline in a drama movie.
Thank you for your interest in the movie I recommended. Now enjoy your movie. Good bye.
You're welcome! Till next time.
Hello there. I'm here for a recommendation of a movie to watch.
Hi. Certainly. I'm always here to help. Do you mind telling me your preference in the movie search? Any particular theme you'd prefer?
Yes. I'm hosting a children's birthday party, and would like to play a movie in the party. I'm looking for a movie that's suitable for children to watch.
May I ask what streaming platform you'll be using to play the movie? Is there a particular birthday theme you'd also like to incorporate in the movie?
Yes. I'll be streaming the movie from Netflix, and it's a dog themed party.
Since it's a dog themed birthday party. I'd recommended the movie "Benji". It's a remake of the original Benji, not only it sends a good message but it fits your dog themed party perfectly.
Sounds great. i'll have to check it out myself.
Here is the link of Benji https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1799516/. I wonder if there is any aspect you'd like to see in the movie?
I hope to be entertained, and received some positive messages for children to follow.
For sure. Thank you for your interest in the movie search, and I hope you have a successful party and also enjoy the movie I selected for you.
Thanks.
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi!! I am looking for a movie to watch by myself. I love action films and I really love movies that are futuristic or science fiction

I understand. Would you like your futuristic movie to be optimistic or pessimistic about the future? If you are thinking about Science Fiction, do you want to be shocked or awed? I could go for either. But I do enjoy movie that challenge my beliefs.
I am not swayed by either. I want the action to be plentiful
Do you have any content restrictions?
No, I don't care. I am an adult and I can watch anything
What would be the subgenres of your movie?
I don't know. I guess I can do anything. I'd like there to be lots of action. I think I could be enticed with a movie that hints at life-lessons or observations about humanity
Do you have a specific actor, director, or producer in mind?
I think an actor like Keaneu Reeves would be nice. He is very talented

I think I have the right movie for you. How about "The Matrix". Here is the link to its page on Rotten Tomatos,

https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/matrix

It is a movie about the future where humanity has lost control to robots. Take a look around and see if this fits well with your criteria
Wow I think I really like this movie!
What was it that made you choose this movie if I can ask?

It looks like it has a lot of action. A lot of the reviews describe it as being a cool film about a tough guy who tries to fight against a system. I like the words they use to describe. I think I have heard one of my coworkers talk about this film.
Well thank you for allowing me to give you a recommendation. Thank you for your time and I hope to see you soon
No thank you for the great recommendation
What did you look about "The Matrix"? Are there any themes that you felt close to? Was it the actors?

All of it actually! Keaneu Reeves was amazing, it was like you could feel his hesitations. I also liked the slight coloring of the movie. It felt like green and black were the only color of the movie. That really transported me to another place. I also enjoyed the dystopian theme.
Hello!
Hi there! Are you looking for a movie again? What seasonal/timely themes are you looking for?
I am not sure. Could you suggest some?

Are you looking for science-fiction/futuristic movies again? I could provide you yet another recommendation similar to this theme. Based on our previous conversation, you enjoyed action movies about the future and/or science fiction. I think you will enjoy "The Matrix Reloaded". It has the same themes. It is second part to the first part. It is also very well received according to user reviews. Here is a link to the Rotten Tomatoes page:

https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/matrix_reloaded


I
Wow thank you! This one seems just as good as the first one. I know movie sequels tend to be hard to make as they are supposed to keep the essence of the first without mimicking the first.
Please do tell why this movie seemed interesting to you.
I like that it has the green hue to it yet again. I like that the it features the same actors and same characters. The user reviews exclaim that there is even more action than the first!
Well I am glad and thankful to help you yet again!
Thanks! It's nice to see Keaneu Reeves return
done
done

dialogue.message: Hi!!!
Hi there! Are you interested in a recommendation for a movie party, or just watching on your own?
I want to watch a movie with my friends. We are all adults
What streaming platform do you have access to?
I have Hulu, Netflix, HBO Max, and Fandango, although I ultimately prefer HBO Max

Wow thanks for being very specific. I know we all have that one platform that works everytime! Anyways, what preferences are you and your friends thinking of? Are you looking for an American movie or something different?
I don't care where my movie comes from. As long as it has English subtitles, I don't even care that the dialogue is in another language. I just want the best horror movie you can give me

Do you recall my previous recommendation, "The Matrix"? Well, this one has even higher reviews than "The Matrix". It is called "The Wailing". It is a Korean movie and the dialogue is in Korean. But it has English subtitles, it's available on HBO Max, and it is a horror movie. Here is its page on Rotten Tomatoes:

https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_wailing
This movie looks great. I never thought any movie could have 99% score on Rotten Tomatoes
May I ask, what helped you make your decision to watch this movie?
I saw all the reviews. A lot of people like the debate between good versus evil! I found the reviews very helpful
Thank you for allowing me to recommend this movie to you! I hope you and your friends enjoy it!
You are welcome. On my behalf, you can rest assured that I embrace your recommendation. I hope my friends like it as well and if they do, I will let you know next time I logon

cultural_preferences_like: does not care about the movie's origin

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Ok great! I'm trying to find a movie that I can watch by myself.
That's a great idea! Do you have any content or genres that you don't like?
I don't want to watch any documentaries or historical movies.
What types of movies are you interested in watching? Are there any particular genres that you are in the mood for?
I would love to watch a good horror movie right now.
What streaming platforms do you have available to you at the moment? Also, do you have any favorite actors or directors that you'd like to see in a horror movie?
I have access to amazon prime and netflix. I don't care much about the directors or actors in it.
Do you prefer modern horror movies or classic horror movies? Also, what type of mood are you currently in?
I am more in the mood for something modern. And I am in an adventurous mood.

I would recommend the movie Day Shift. The link to it is https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13314558/. It is available on Netflix right now and is the story of a vampire hunter who has an adventure while trying to take care of his daughter.
That sounds awesome! I will definitely have to check that one out!
I'm glad you like that idea! What about Day Shift makes you so excited to watch it?
Well, I love vampires. I thought I had seen every vampire movie but I didn't know about this one! So, I'm really excited to watch it now.

I am so happy that you are pleased and excited with the recommendation! Thank you for letting me know that I did a good job in my pick for you! It has been a pleasure serving you today, please come back any time you need more recommendations!
Thank you so much! You did a wonderful job and it was my pleasure! I will see you again soon!
Hey there, I'm back for more recommendations!
It's so good to see you again, welcome back! Is there a special occasion that you are wanting a movie recommendation for?
No, I just really liked the last movie your recommended, so I thought I'd come back and get another!
I'm so glad to hear that! It's really great to see you again! Where are you wanting to watch this movie, and do you have any movie preferences?
I'll be watching it at home, and yes. I'd like another movie with the same actor and director as the last one.
Could you tell me which actor and director you are referring to and what you liked about them?
The actor was Jamie Foxx and his acting was incredible. J.J. Perry was the director and I just really enjoyed his pacing with the movie.

I have a recommendation for you! Unfortunately, Jamie Foxx and J.J. Perry only made one movie together, however, there is another Jamie Foxx movie on Netflix that has a similar style and tone to Day Shift. It is called Project Power! The link is https://www.imdb.com/title/tt7550000/. I think you will like if very much since you enjoyed Day Shift. What do you think?
This looks perfect! I definitely want to watch this right away! Thank you!
That's great! What specifically makes you want to watch Project Power so much? Is it the story? The adventure? The actors?
Yes, all of them! I love the actors in this and the sci fi and adventure elements make it right up my alley. I think I will even like it more than Day Shift!

That's wonderful! Thank you so much for letting me know, it really makes my day to know I gave a good recommendation! It has been a pleasure serving you. Please come back again soon for more recommendations!
You're very welcome! I will definitely be back soon! Bye for now!
Hey there! I am back again for another movie recommendation from you!

It's so good to see you back so soon! You must have really enjoyed Project Power! Will you be watching the movie with friends or family this time? Do you have any seasonal preferences seeing as how it is getting close to Christmas? What are you in the mood for today?
Actually, this time I will be watching the movie with my family. I am actually in the mood for a nice funny family comedy. It does not need to be Christmas themed.

That sounds wonderful! It's always nice to spend time with the family. Do you have any actors or directors that you enjoy when watching family comedies? Are there any other themes you would enjoy watching?

I really like Jennifer Garner. I feel like she is an amazing actor. I don't really care about the director. I'd like the theme to involve the parents and the kids learning to understand each other better.

You are in luck because I have the perfect movie for you! Family Switch is a movie starring Jennifer Garner and is about a mom and dad that switch places with their son and daughter. The link is https://www.imdb.com/title/tt14227048/. What do you think?
This is perfect! Just what I was looking for! This looks hilarious, I can't wait to watch it!
That's wonderful! Can you tell what excites you the most about Family Switch and why you want to watch it so much?
Sure! I love body swap movies and this looks really funny! It also looks like it has a strong message of trying to understand what life is like in other people's shoes.
I'm so glad to hear that! Thank you so much for the enthusiasm, I love to know that I did a good job! It's been a pleasure serving you once again, I hope to see you again soon!
It has been a pleasure! Thank you so much for the help. Until next time!

special_occasion: theme involving parents and kids understanding each other
movie_like: movies with a strong message about understanding others

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Give me an animated horror film to watch alone.
I don't have any restrictions or preferences, as long as it fits the genre
On second thought, would you be able to recommend a stop motion film? Preferably with a PG rating?
Will you be watching it alone or with others?
Alone preferably.
Any seasonal themed or timed release preferences? How do you feel currently?
Either Halloween or Christmas, released in the early 2000s. I feel relaxed right now, but I don't mind if the movie gets a reaction out of me.
Is there a particular actor or director you're interested in, or wish to avoid? What language would you like to watch the movie in?
None in particular, and a movie in english would be nice.

https://www.amazon.com/Coraline-Dakota-Fanning/dp/B002BWCJOA
Coraline (2009) is my personal recommendation to you! It's a breathtaking stop motion spectacular starring a troubled young girl as she ebbs between our world and an unknown, utopian parallel universe, but everything is not as it seems! This movie is full of suspense and dark imagery, quite shocking for a kids movie as evident by its reviews! Are you satisfied with this selection?
Yeah, I think I'll check this film out, thank you!
No problem! If I may ask, what about this film drew you to it? What was your first impression?

I think the juxtaposition between the genre and rating is interesting, and the animation itself exemplary for its time, The synopsis left me with a sense of intrigue, and now I have this urge to delve deeper into the mysteries of this film.

I agree, this film really keeps you at the edge of your seat, and I think you'll enjoy how it unfolds and reveals its wonderous contents to you! I'm glad you took an interest in my recommendation, and I wish you a happy (or spooky) movie night!
Thanks again, I appreciate your counsel!
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi, I'm looking for a comedy for tonihgt. Any ideas? Whoops, you seemed to have copied something wrong there! Anything goes, preferably something simple that will make me crack up!

Just me and my husband. We like rom coms a lot!

We like newer ones - the worse the rating on Rottentomatoes, the better!

I read the reviews and it just seems too good not to watch. I like Amazon's rom coms too, so maybe this will be wuite good

thanks!

I think the golden age of rom coms is 2000-2010. Any good similar recs?

https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/marry_me_2022 have you seen marry me? its from last year but has owen wilson. very well rated!
No i haven't. let's do that!

Probably just watching Owen being Owen! he's so funny

tahnks

yeah sounds great to me!

Theyre often fun and funny, which make them super watchable

Hi, I'm really stumped for what movie to watch. I fancy something new
Well, I'm more than happy to help you, where are you looking g to watch a movie?
Well, I've got he house to myself, so I'm looking to watch something  my wife wouldn't normally go for. I really like Sci fi and action
OK, is it safe to assume you're over 18, with being married and all?
Yeah, I'm 37.
Right, you mentioned action and sci-fi as well as having the house to yourself. Can I recommend a double feature?
Sure go for it!
Alien and aliens could be the movies for you. Alien was directed by ridley scott, aliens the sequel was directed by James Cameron.  Both star Sigourney Weaver
I'm a big fan of both of those directors!
You have taste! Well Alien is a dark suspense filled masterpiece and fits into the sci-fi genre perfectly and the sequel is an action packed all guns blazing feature. Sound good?
Sounds fantastic, can you tell me more about the storyline?

The main premise is a group of workers on a space freighter, come across the site of an alien landing , one of them.becomes infected with a parasite which wreaks havoc on returning  to the ship 

https://m.imdb.com/title/tt0078748/
That fits the bill amazingly. My wife would never sit and watch that with me! Thankyou for your help!
What makes you say that your wife would never sit and watch that with you? Are there any other genres that you only get to watch alone?

She hates Sci-fi! Thinks it's for geeks, she also struggles with anything scary. Givers her nightmares and then I have her waking me up all night. As for other genres she won't entertain thay I love, stoner comedy.

OK, well I'm.glad I could help you find Alien, if you like the first one, you'll love the sequels. 

I'm here fore you if you ned any  more help picking out more movies.  I've got plenty of recommendations for stoner comedies if you want as well.
Great! I'll be in touch, thanks again.

More than happy to help. Glad you enjoyed Alien.  Is your wife still away? I remember you saying you were into finding some stoner comedy. Is that still what you're looking for?
It is! A guilty pleasure I know, but the wife's away so I might as well make hay while the sun shines. I really like the old Cheech and Ching movies but I'm looking for something a bit more modern.
We don't judge! I remember last time you were talking about liking action movies. What if I had a suggestion for a stoner action comedy?
If such a thing truly exists, than I would jump at the chance! What have you got for me?

Pineapple Express! This movie sounds like it was made just for you.

It's a weed smoking, gun blasting laugh a minute movie.

https://m.imdb.com/title/tt0910936/

I'll add it to the list, I fancy watching g a bit more straight up action
Glad I could help, if you want straight up action  from the director of Aliens, terminator 2 is a james cameron masterpiece. Check it out and get back to me whenever you like
Thanks, I'll be in touch!

It's riddled with comedy, it's directed by Richard Curtis, famous for other classic British romantic comedies that also have something for everybody. 

https://m.imdb.com/title/tt0314331/

Does your  wife like any other genres of movies?
Nah, she's a total cookie cutter wife, rom coms and period costume dramas, snore. Ots a good job she's hot.

Sounds like you're lucky to have each other . If you need any help picking out something you can both watch, or maybe if you want me to find you some romantic sci-fi and see if we can get her to watch something cooler, just give me a shout. Speak soon.
Thanks again!

There are so much good movies that are good to watch

Yes. I would highly recommend you to watch it with your friends
Yes I will denitely make out a plan to watch it.

please tell me bit about the story

Katherine, a former TV star, wakes up in hospital after a severe accident has left her with “locked in” syndrome, whereby she is completely paralysed and cannot communicate. A nurse called Nicky begins to work with Katherine, to try to help her regain some bodily control. Nicky seeks information about Katherine from Lina, who is the wife of Jamie, Katherine's step-son. Katherine also acted as Lina’s guardian after the death of her mother.

Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.

Hi, I am travelling home for Christmas so need to keep my 11 year old daughter entertained for the journey. It should only take us a couple of hours but I'd like to have a few options for some films that will keep her amused.  She particularly enjoys animation and cartoons, it would be nice if it could be a festive film to get us in the Holiday mood. I need to know the film is relevant and age appropriate so I can leave her to watch it, if necessary. Are you able to help with some suggestions?
Certainly, I'd be happy to help. Are there any themes or genres you are looking to avoid? This will help ensure my suggestions are age appropriate for you
Thank you - just nothing to scary or shocking, I'd hate to spoil Christmas on the journey home by frightening her!

Ok, great - thank you. Please can I check what your daughter is usually interested in? Are there any other films or particular genres that she's enjoyed recently?  This will help me tailor the recommendations to her preferences.

Sure, like most girls her age she loves Disney princesses and playing with dolls. She really enjoyed Moana and The Little Mermaid so she enjoys a strong, relatable female protaganist and an interesting story. Something engaging and lighthearted without being too scary or upsetting.  She enjoys cartoons and has an interest in art and drawing so likes different animation styles and cute characters.
Ok thank you. Can I check what devices you have available and what streaming platforms you are subscribed to? This will help me make relevant recommendations.
Great - we have an iPad and subscriptions to Amazon Prime, Netflix and Disney+. I'd be happy to rent a film if I was sure she would like it.

Ok, I have a few suggestions for you:

1. The Tiger Who Came to Tea (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt8010354/) available on Amazon Prime and All4 - a short 25 minute film where a young girl befriends a tiger and invites him over for tea. Your daughter should enjoy and relate to the story of our young heroine Sophie, bold and brave in her adventure. She should also enjoy the subtly beautiful animation style.

2. Frozen 2 (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4520988/) available on Disney+ - sisters Anna and Elsa return in this 1hr 45min film. Your daughter should enjoy the strong female leads and their relationship. Elsa queen of snow and ice will get your daughter into the festive spirit with this beautiful animated Disney classic. 

Let me know what you think?
These sound great - it's nice to have a few different options and these all sound relevant. Thank you
You are welcome. Is there anything I've missed or would you like any further suggestions?
Hopefully that should cover us for the journey. Do you have another option of the a longer feature length film in case we're delayed?

Sure - how about Dr Seuss' The Grinch available on Amazon Prime (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2709692/) - runtime 1 hr 25 minutes and this should be sure to keep your daughter entertained. She should particularly enjoy our sweet, feisty heroine Cindy-Lou Who, who helps our curmudgeonly Grinch who plots to ruin Christmas for the village, hopefully Cindy can save the day and show the spirit of Christmas! The fun, playful animation should be enjoyable as well as a very cute dog! What do you think?
That sounds perfect - thank you!
Hi, are you able to recommend another film with one of the same directors or actors from your previous suggestions?

I'd be happy to help. Was there anything or anyone in particular you enjoyed from the previous suggestions? Do you have any preference for what kind of movies I recommend and do you still have access to the same streaming services?

Thank you - I'm looking for something funny and light-hearted to watch with all the family. We loved the style and story of the Grinch and my daughter particularly like the cute animated dog. All our streaming services are the same.
How old are any of the children watching? And are these any specific themes or concepts you'd like the film to include?
The children are 11 and 8 and I will be watching with them. Just something that will make us all laugh with some funny and unique characters

In that case, here are my suggestions:

1. The Secret Life of Pets (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2709768/) - available on Netflix - directed by Chris Renaud who also directed our previous suggestion the Grinch. With the same sweet animation style and lots of cute and funny animal characters! You should all be sure to enjoy this adventurous, laugh out loud escapade. Your daughters should enjoy the strong female characters.

2. Paw Patrol the Mighty Movie (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt15837338/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1) - available on Paramount Plus through Amazon Prime. With the voice of Kristen Bell from our previous suggestion Frozen 2. You should all enjoy the strong canine superheroes using their powers to save the world! THe sweet, enchanting animation style with the strong girl power story should have you all entertained and highly amused. What do you think?
That sounds great! Exactly what I was looking form thank you.
Great - is there a particular option you're most excited about? And is there anything specifically that interests you?

The Secret Life of Pets sounds like it should be very funny and we loved the style of the Grinch, I'm really looking forward to being able to enjoy some sweet laughs as a family.  I'm not sure if we'll be able to watch your second suggestions as we don't have a subscription to Paramount+ at the moment.
Thank you, that will help me make future suggestions. Enjoy your films and thank you for chatting today
Thank you
You are welcome
Done

dialogue.message: Hi there, I'm looking for a film to watch with my friends. We normally like scary or horror movies, we;re hoping to get together to have a party and watch together. The scarier the better!
No problem - please can you let me know what streaming platforms you use and if you and your friends' have any specific movie preferences. Is this for a special occasion?

Yes - we're 20-somethign year old students just getting together for a movie night with popcorn etc. We're hoping for a scary thriller to shock us all and be part of our 'fright night'. As we're students, we only have Amazon Prime Video as it's available at a discount price for us.
Ok so we're looking for something shocking and scary to keep you on the edge of your seat? And it should be available through Amazon Prime?
Yes, we'd like a suspenseful thriller with a scary story and creepy characters. With a plot that keeps twisting and evolving and is currently on Amazon Prime.

Ok, here are some suggestions for you:

Joy Ride (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0206314/) - available on Amazon Prime - The story of three young people on a road trip from Colorado to New Jersey talk to a trucker on their CB radio, then must escape when he turns out to be a psychopathic killer. Watch out for the twists and turns in this one, with a particularly shocking and gruesome twist ending... 

2. The Silence of the Lambs (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0102926/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1) - available on Amazon Prime - a creepy and thrilling classic - a young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims. Anthony Hopkins is particularly disturbing as a serial killer, this one will have you frightened and entertained. What do you think?
These sounds great! We've been meaning to watch Silence of the Lambs for years and we absolute love a plot that keeps us guessing and terrified so Joy Ride sounds great.
Is there anything specifically you're looking forward to or interested in with these suggestions?

Yes - we love that the characters in Joy Ride are a similar age to us so the story is even more relatable. We also loved Paul Walker in the Fast and Furious movies, so we look forward to watching him. We also love true crime and the psychology behind killers so The Silence of the Lambs should be a great one for us to watch and analyze
Great - thank you for your feedback. Enjoy your films and thanks for your time today, it's been a pleasure to help
Thank you
You are very welcome
Done

Hello I would like to see a movie with my best friend and can't think of any ones in particular that we would both like?

Oh not really, however id rather avoid any historical films or dull documentaries since I have enough of that already at college. Maybe a comedy of fantasy film instead?
Oh great choices, nothing like a good comedy or fantasy film to get the imagination going. Would you prefer an old classic style film or more of a modern day film?

Right well that's great as it gives me the opportunity to recommend a wide variety of films for you from old to new! 
A great old favourite is the fantasy film Labyrinth 1986 which stars the great David Bowie and has a lot of cool twists and cool characters in: https://m.imdb.com/title/tt0091369/

Another old classic movie would be ET 1982 a film about an extra terrestrial from outer space who befriends a young boy. Here's some details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.T._the_Extra-Terrestrial

Oh I don't think I've ever heard of these two movies before but they do sound very appealing and entertaining. Any other suggestions for more newer movies too so that I have a good mix of old and new movies to choose from?

I'm glad that my suggestions so far are suitable for your requirements and as for newer movies let me see..
Here's the Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone movie which has lots of magic and adventure mixed in and has received world wide praise: https://m.imdb.com/title/tt0241527/?ref_%3Dnv_sr_1

Another movie I would recommend would be Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, it's about a young hobbit and friends going on a difficult adventure to help save their people: https://m.imdb.com/title/tt0120737/ I hope these suggestions will be useful in helping you find the best movies for you and your friend to enjoy.
Oh they sound familiar, I haven't gotten round to watching these movies but have heard great things about them from friends and family! Thank you!
I'm glad you like my suggestions and these are a perfect mix of movies that fit into your requirements.
Oh yes thank you. My friend also likes the fact that you have recommended both old and new movies to watch together.
That's great to hear, both you and your friend have great taste and are open minded in your requirements. I'm glad I could help today.
Thanks again for the movie suggestions I look forward to speaking to you again sometime. Bye for now!

It's a classic 90s action movie that combines a slight comedic tone with social commentary and sci-fi elements. It is also just under 2 hours long. How does this sound?

Sure, will you be watching alone tonight or with others? Also, would you like to watch a new movie or an older one?
I'm alone tonight and don't care about when the movie came out, but would prefer one that I haven't seen before.
What TV/streaming services do you have access to at the moment?
I have Sky Cinema, Netflix & Amazon Prime subs atm.
That's a solid viewing range, so we should be able to find you something. In regards to the Sci-fi & Fantasy genre, may I ask what some of your favourites are, so I can tailor your request?
I'm a big fan of the more epic movies and TV shows - things like Star Trek & Lord of the Rings.
How about "Interstellar" (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0816692/?ref_=chttp_t_22), its among one of the more grandiose Space movies and one of the most well regarded.
Yes, I have been meaning to watch that for ages, but Matthew McConaughey irritates me.  Yeah thats perfect. Thanks
What is it about Matthew McConaughey that you don't like?
Oh just that he's a bit of a arrogant hippy Hollywood lovie type, but thats not an issue. Interstellar will be a great choice and its avaiable on Sky Cinema too.
Well I'm very happy to hear that. I hope you enjoy your movie selection and remember I'm always hear for any recommendations you might need.
Cool. Thx a lot:)
Hi again:) That movie you recommended - Interstellar - was great. Can you suggest something by  the same director?
Do you have any preferences in regards to Director Christopher Nolan?
Nah I just want to explore his style.
Would you like a recommendation in the Sci-Fi genre as before?
Yeah that would be good, it is my fav:)

How about "Inception", it is also a Sci-fi movie and is definitely considered epic - which is something I know you enjoy. You can get information on it at the following imdb link: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1375666/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_7_dr
I can't believe it, another blockbuster that I've been meaning to see, that has slipped my mind.  Its on Sky cinema also, perfect. Thx again dude.
That's great. Any particular reason you have been meaning to watch this film also?
Oh just that it was super hyped when it came out and got good reviews and like you know is totally epic.
I'm glad that the recommendation was helpful for you. As always I'm here if you need any further help.
Cool. Tyvm.
Hey again. I'm looking for another movie recommendation. I've got a friend coming over and we'd like to watch something.
Can I ask is this a special occasion and maybe a little about your friends preferences? Also, would you prefer something more seasonal at this festive time of year?
No special occasion and my friend is fairly easy, though she loves books like I do. Christmas movie might be cool, but not essential.

How about something in the Fantasy genre this time - "Harry Potter & the Philosopher's Stone". While an adaptation or a children's book, it is considered hugely popular. It is also considered epic with multiple movies in the series and has many enjoyable Christmas themes (though it does not centre on such). It is also currently on Sky Cinema too. I could search for something produced more recently or of a more adult nature, if that doesn't suit?
No Harry Potter is perfect. We are both huge fans and have been meaning the rewatch all the films. Thx.
Is there anything specific that makes you want to re watch Harry Potter & the Philosopher's Stone (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0241527/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_1_tt_7_nm_0_q_harry%2520potter) so much?
We just think they are great movies and we were both working in the same bookshop when they came out. It was a magical time:)
That's great to hear. As always, I'm here for all your movie recommendation needs.
Thx dude:)

Thank you for the feed back it is much appreciate. I hope you enjoy the movie! Bye now

As i mentioned, I like knights in armour, so 9th-13th century. The could be based on fact or based on fiction I dont mind. I dont have any actor or director preferences, but I do like the A24 film studio.

Thank you for the information. I have found a movie from A24 studio that is based in the time period you have a preference for. The movie is called the Green Knight and contains elements of fantasy. The movie can be found here: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9243804/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1
Thank you this movie looks very intriguing based on the trailer. I can see that it contains elements of fantasy which I like.

The film looks well made and well acted. The actors are some that I recognise like Joel Edgerton and Dev Patel. The setting of the time period looks authentically recreated and will be engaging and has an element of mystery to unfold.

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi! Can you help me pick out a movie that would be good to watch with my girlfriends?
Do you have a preference of genre or movie rating?
Any rating is fine, including rated R. I like comedies and Rom-Coms.
Do you prefer newer movies or older movies?
I don't mind. Any year is fine.
What type of movies do you usually watch and what do you like about them?
I enjoy Rom-Coms because of the mix of romance and comedy. They have their serious moments but are also very funny.

I would recommend How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0251127/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_8_nm_0_q_how%2520to%2520los It is about a woman named Andie who wants to write a serious article about how her friend's behavior is what drives men away. She finds a guy to date and drive away but ends up falling in love with him with plenty of funny moments along the way. What do you think about this recommendation?
I think that sounds like something I'd really enjoy because of the mix of serious, romance and comedy.
What exactly is it about the mix of serious, romance and comedy that you like? Are there any specific themes you enjoy in movies?
I think the mix of serious, romance and comedy just give the movie a good balance. I'm open to most themes, I just don't like anything too corny like dancing or musicals.
Thank you so much for letting me help you pick out a movie! I hope you enjoy it!
Thank you for helping, I'm sure I will!

Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi, that sounds great, thank you.  I'm looking for a Christmas film to watch.
To help me select the best film for you, can you tell me if there's anything you'd want to avoid in a film or any restrictions on things like age suitability please?
Sure, I'll be watching with my kids so nothing that's too scary or rated for older than PG please.
And are there any genres of films that you prefer around Christmastime?
Something with a good dose of humour would be good.
And are there any actors you particularly like, or directors you've enjoyed films by in the past?
I don't have particularly strong views, maybe Michael Caine?  Not a fan of Rowan Atkinson though!

How about a Muppet Christmas carol?  That's got Michael Caine in it - you can find out more here on IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0104940/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1 or alternatively if you want something a bit funnier, Elf doesn't have Michael Caine but meets your other requirements: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0319343/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1.
Hmm, not sure about the Muppets, I think I'll give Elf a try!  That looks funny and very Christmassy.
What was it about Elf that you liked the sound of particularly?
I like that the main character shares his name with my son's Elf on the Shelf!  It also sounds like it'll be particularly good for children.
Fantastic!  I hope you enjoy watching Elf with the children and have a lovely Christmas!
Thanks, goodbye!
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
That sounds good. I'm looking for a movie I can watch with my girlfriend.
Do you have anything specific you'd like to watch or like to avoid?
I like speculative fiction. Nothing too gory; my girlfriend doesn't love it. I'd like something with interesting themes that sparks discussion, nothing too brainless or silly.
What genre preferences do you and your girlfriend  have?
Speculativecfiction, like I said. More sci-fi or horror rather than fantasy.
Are you and your girlfriend watching by yourselves or with others?
By ourselves.
What sort of tone are you looking for in the film aside from genre, and what streaming platforms do you have access to?
Exciting, tense, good character drama. Streaming platform doesn't matter, I'll just get a physical copy.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0066921/

This is A Clockwork Orange. It's a sci-fi film with horror elements. The focus is on the lead, Alex, and his rehabilitation.
That's a bit too gory for our tastes. Could you suggest something a little lighter?

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0338013/
This is Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. It's a sci-fi film about a man who has lost the memory of someone close to him, but he doesn't know why.
I'd like something with a bit more of a grounded narrative.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120382/
This is The Truman Show. It's a sci-fi film about a man whose life is broadcast for the entire world.
Nice choice! I'm happy with that one.
What do you like specifically about this choice?
It has an interesting concept satirizing reality tv, with enough tension to get invested in the situation.
Thank you for your input. I hope you enjoy the movie with your girlfriend!
Will do!
Farewell for now.
Farewell.
Let me know if you need assistance in the future.
Will do!
Howdy!

Hello. What are your preferences in terms 
of region or culture in film, and do you have any specific actors you like or dislike?

I like Japanese films, but I'd like to stick to English for today. American films will do nicely. I like actors that show range. If they're basically playing themselves in every film, they're not as compelling.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0097165/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_7_dr
You may like Dead Poets Society. It has the same director as the previous recommendation I gave you, and it stars Robin Williams, who is known for this range beyond comedy.
Interesting! I like that, but do you have something more in a speculative fiction category?
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0119528/?ref_=ttls_li_tt Liar Liar stars Jim Carrey, the same as The Truman Show, with the sci-fi concept of "what if a person couldn't lie?".
I like it! But could you give me another recommendation for variety?
What sort of themes would you like?
Oh, same as before. Speculative fiction, just another movie in the same vein.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0481369/?ref_=ttls_li_tt
The Number 23 is a movie about a man who discovers a literary alter ego who seems eerily similar to himself. Starring Jim Carrey.
Interesting! I've never heard of that before. I'll have to check it out.

1900s or modern day, not scary, any platform is fine, British preferred, no horror, just my parents, my Dad's favourite film is One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest; they tend to like Anthony Hopkins too, nothing on the rest.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt20420628/
Freud's Last Session has British actors, is recent, and stars Anthony Hopkins. However, it is too recent to have won any awards. Is this film to your taste?

maybe you could tell me your favourite film? that might help me come up with some suggestions for you for similar movies?
i don't like musical films. they are not my cup of tea at all.

excellent! so, something crime-based would be a good place to start for you.

Perfect. I've got a few suggestions, one classic, one a few years old and one modern:

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2267998/?ref_=ttls_li_tt

For LA Confidential and The French Connection it is the actors. Gene Hackmann is a giant of an actor and LA Confidential is rammed with great talent. For Gone Girl it is the story. it looks like something you've seen before...but i anticipate being surprised by it.

have a great evening watching your movie!
thanks for your help tonight.

dialogue.message: Good evening. I would like to watch a film with Gene Hackmann in it, please. I really enjoyed the French Connection.

No problem! do you want to see an older Gene Hackmann movie, or something more modern, i.e. after 2000?

have you got any preference on what kind of movie it is, or just that it has to be a Gene Hackmann movie?
The only criteria is Gene Hackmann. I am open to any time period, any kind of movie be that crime, comedy, drama...whatever. i don't mind.
OK. should we look at some more classic movies of his? something from the 70's and 80's, as you enjoyed the French Connection from this era?
that sounds perfect!

As you enjoyed the crime movie last time, i've got another crime movie which I think you will like:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mississippi_Burning

As well as Gene Hackman it also stars Willem Dafoe, who is another great actor.

This movie is about an FBI investigation into the disappearance of civil rights workers and confronts the viewer with some harsh realities of the time. I think it is another great one to watch by yourself.
that looks like it is exactly my kind of thing
I am very happy to hear that! what is it specifically about this which interests you (other than Gene Hackman)? is there a specific aspect you find particularly appealing?
it is two great actors in a crime drama, and it focuses on a part of our history which should be exposed and confronted.
I am really glad we found something you like the look of and for interacting with me. i hope to help you again in the near future with more film choices. have a great evening watching the movie.
thank you. good night.

dialogue.message: hello again. i need your help with a movie choice once more! i am having a friend over for pizza and movies - he's a bit of a film buff so need something to appeal to him.

As always, no trouble at all.

Let's start with a few details:

 - what streaming platforms have you got access to?
 - has your friend ever mentioned any actors or directors whose films they particularly like or don't like?

he's mentioned a few, but i can't remember their names. i'm not a real movie buff myself, i just enjoy them in the moment without analysing them too much. he has said that he really likes the old classics like Hitchcock though.

Is there a particular theme that you want to have for the evening? i.e. do you want to keep it light hearted or more serious and in depth movies?

do you think we should focus on Alfred Hitchcock or some other classic directors like Stanley Kubrik?
i think we should focus on Alfred Hitchcock. i would like to watch some of his movies too as I have only ever seen one of them.

Perfect. that allows us to start narrowing it down to a few Hitchcock classics!

1) Vertigo
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vertigo_(film)

2) The Man Who Knew Too Much
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Man_Who_Knew_Too_Much_(1956_film)

3) Strangers On A Train
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strangers_on_a_Train_(film)

All of these have an element of Crime Drama and intrigue which I think you will enjoy and your friend will be impressed by, even if he has seen them already.

Oh wow! I think we'll have to make it a double-header! I will select The Man Who Knew Too Much and Strangers On A Train. Vertigo doesn't have the same interest for me as the other two. I can't wait to watch them.

Glad to have helped - i think you'll both have a great night watching these two movies.

What is it about them that you particularly like the look of?

Strangers On A Train sounds incredible with the deception and dishonesty involved in the two characters. i want to see how they get to the point so quickly, i.e. how about we kill each others partners? that seems incredible!

It does sound good, doesn't it? how does Hitchcock make something which sounds so farfetched, realistic! i think you'll have a great time finding out.

enjoy your pizza and movie night and I hope to be able to help you again soon!
thank you so much once again.

movie_like: The Man Who Knew Too Much

Are you looking for an action movie or something more cerebral?
I'm looking for something that will get me thinking not  shoot em up
So you like science fiction that will stretch your mind a little?
Yes that would be great

Ok I have a couple that I can recommend, the first is Interstellar, directed by Christopher Nolan and starring Matthew McConaughey and Anne Hathaway

Here is a link to its IMDB listing rated 8.7/10

Rated: 12A
ok and what is the other one?

The other I have in mind is Gattaca, directed by Andrew Nicol and starring Ethan Hawke and Uma Thurman.

Here is a link to its IMDB Rating

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0119177/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_8_nm_0_q_gattaca

Rate 7.7/10

Rated 15
I like Christopher Nolan films. So what is Interstellar about?

Briefly: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.  It deals with time travel and has a decent amount of literate science in it.
Great, that sounds interesting.  What is the music like?

The soundtrack was composed by Hans Zimmer, I will include a link to it so you can listen to it if you wish

https://www.google.com/search?gs_ssp=eJzj4tbP1TcwNLIwMbQ0MGD0kshIzCtWqMrMzU0tUsjMK0ktKi5JzclJLAIA2hcMpA&q=hans+zimmer+interstellar&oq=hans+zimmer+inte&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUqDQgBEC4YgwEYsQMYgAQyEAgAEAAYgwEY4wIYsQMYgAQyDQgBEC4YgwEYsQMYgAQyBwgCEAAYgAQyBwgDEC4YgAQyBggEEEUYQDIGCAUQRRg5MgcIBhAuGIAEMgcIBxAAGIAE0gEKMjIxOTlqMWoxNagCALACAA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8
Thank you, so what is gattaca about?

In the not-too-distant future, a less-than-perfect man wants to travel to the stars. Society has categorized Vincent Freeman as less than suitable given his genetic make-up and he has become one of the underclass of humans that are only useful for menial jobs. To move ahead, he assumes the identity of Jerome Morrow, a perfect genetic specimen who is a paraplegic as a result of a car accident. With professional advice, Vincent learns to deceive DNA and urine sample testing. Just when he is finally scheduled for a space mission, his program director is killed and the police begin an investigation, jeopardizing his secret.

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
i'm in the mood for an action movie with slo mo scenes

I would recommend Sucker Punch.  

According to Wikipedia, 
"Sucker Punch is a 2011 American psychological fantasy action film directed by Zack Snyder and co-written by Snyder and Steve Shibuya. It is Snyder's first film based on an original concept. The film stars Emily Browning as 'Babydoll', a young woman who is committed to a mental institution. As she collects items she needs to escape, she enters a series of fantasy worlds where she and her fellow inmates are strong, experienced warriors. Abbie Cornish, Jena Malone, Vanessa Hudgens, Jamie Chung, Carla Gugino, and Oscar Isaac also star."
Source:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sucker_Punch_(2011_film)

Its IMDB rating is 6.0/10, but critics tend to assign lower ratings to action movies.  Sucker Punch is relatively popular with fans of action movies, with a popularity rating of 1,086. 
Source:  https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0978764/
okay thanks...i've seen that one actually.  we have so much in common.  anyway, can you recommend another Zack Snyder movie?  what is he known for?

I have a few potential options for you.  But first, are there any content restrictions that you had in mind?  In other words, does the rating of the movie matter to you, or anyone who you plan to watch it with?  

You said you're looking for an action movie, with slo mo scenes, directed by Zack Snyder.  

Do you want an action movie with comedy, or drama, or does it matter?
ummm well im watching with my parents so nothing too explicit...aside from that, no preference.
Okay, I can recommend action movies with a PG-13 rating or lower.  Does that sound good to you?
sure that works
Okay, great.  Are there any specific actors whose films you avoid?
not that I can think of...

I would recommend Zack Snyder's 2009 film, Watchmen.  It's rated PG-13.  It has the slow motion action scenes that you're looking for.  It's 163 minutes long, i.e. two hours and 43 minutes.  

Wikipedia link:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watchmen_(film)

IMDB link:
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0409459/

Does that sound like the type of movie you're looking for?

The story is set in a futuristic world where technology has advanced to a level where human-like robots have become common. How about Midnight Sky?George Clooney plays the role of Augustine, a scientist stationed in the Arctic who discovers a spacecraft returning from a mission.

The Midnight Sky is visually stunning, with excellent production design and special effects. The acting is also superb, with strong performances from George Clooney and the rest of the cast. At the same time the movie's development is slow-paced, allowing the audience to experience completely Augustine's difficult reality. Moreover, the exploration of the human condition in this post-apocalyptic world offers the possibility to reflect on the themes of human connection, redemption, and sacrifice. The Midnight Sky might not be for everyone for its slow development, but it should.

I like almost all types of movies, but I was thinking of a tearjerker, perhaps something similar to Titanic. I don't have any content restrictions as long as it's nothing extreme.

Yes, a romantic movie would be great.

No, no one in particular, and there's no special occasion.

I would recommend The Notebook from 2004, starring Gena Rowlands, James Garner, and Rachel McAdams. In The Notebook, Duke, a nursing home resident, reads his journal to a fellow female patient, and the journal tells the moving story of the love affair between a city boy and a country girl in North Carolina in the late 1930s. More information about this movie can be found at https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0332280/?ref_=ttls_li_tt

My dad and I aren't too picky, but my mom likes nature, the pioneer lifestyle, and farm animals. If there's a Christian theme, that would make it even better.

I would recommend Redeeming Love (2022), which is set in California during the Gold Rush. This movie is based on Francine Rivers' (who co-wrote the screenplay with D.J. Caruso) novel of the same name that she wrote in 1991. It is based on the biblical story of Hosea. In this movie, a farmer named Michael Hosea who has been praying for God to send him a wife is visiting the town where a prostitute named Angel lives, and he falls in love with her at first sight. The movie uses flashbacks to tell the story of her dark past and how in the present she slowly falls in love with Michael. Even after marrying him and moving to a farm, however, she must still wrestle with her feelings. For more information, see the WIkipedia page at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Redeeming_Love_(2022_film)
Thanks, it doesn't seem like a great fit, though. Do you know of any movies that aren't so dark and also has a little bit of excitement?

Yes, if you're looking for Western that's more traditional, I'd recommend Shane (1953), which is about a gunfighter in Wyoming in the 1880s who begins to envision a quieter life after befriending a homestead family and their young son, but a range war breaks out, he must take action. See https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0046303/?ref_=ttls_li_tt for more information.

I think I would like the sense of justice and duty that Shane has, and I also think the sense of danger appeals to me too.

That's very interesting. Thank you for your thoughts. I hope you have a nice night with your parents. Please feel free to start a new conversation should you be in the mood for any more movie recommendations. Good night.
Thank you, good night!
