dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hey, I am looking to find a film that I can watch with my partner tonight, something that we would both enjoy please.
Do you have any genres in mind that you would like? What are you and your partner's preferences when it comes to films?
We really like gangster and mob movies. Some of the classics from the '80s but one we haven't seen before if possible.
Okay, so you'll be watching it together? How long do you want the film length to be?
Around 2-3 hours, definitely no longer than 3 hours.
What mood do you think you'll be in?
A happy one, because it's close to Christmas and we will have finished work - might even get some food in.
Are there any actors or directors you like?
My favourite director is Martin Scorsese and my partner's favourite actor is Leonardo Di Caprio.

Okay, what about The Departed? That meets all your criteria in terms of length, director and actor. Check it out here: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0407887/

What do you think? It's very highly rated.
Yeah that sounds really good actually, that's pretty much what I was after and we haven't seen it either.
What specifically appeals to you about The Departed that you think you'd like?
I love the cast and the director and anything to do with organised crime will be really cool to watch.
Amazing - well I hope you enjoy the movie!
Thanks - looking forward to it.
Let me know how it goes - and if your partner enjoyed it too!
I will do!
Is this for any type of special occasion?
Just celebrating finishing work for Christmas!

That's awesome, well done you. Enjoy The Departed. Here is the plot if you want to read any more about it: 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Departed
I don't want to read too much - it might spoil it!
Okay, if you have any more requests for films come back to me!
Actually I do, I want to watch another film by Martin Scorsese for the Christmas period. Can you recommend something else?
So I have a really long train journey when I go up to visit my parents over Christmas, and I want a really long film to watch.
What directors or actors do you like? And what type of genre do you fancy watching?
I really like Russell Crowe and Ridley Scott. And I love action films
Do you want to watch and older film or a new one?
An older one please, I just want to pass the time on the journey.

So Gladiator is an older film, with a pretty long runtime and includes both the director and the actor that you like. Check it out here: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0172495/

What do you think?
I love that film and haven't seen it for ages. That's a great recommendation - thank you.
What do you think you'll specifically enjoy about Gladiator and why do you think it would be good to watch on the train?
Well, I love action films and there is lots of action in that, plus it is very dramatic and I can immerse myself in it.
Thank you - I hope you enjoy the film and have a nice time visiting your parents!
That's very kind - thank you!
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hello to you as well, that would be great. I am thinking of watching a movie. Any new recommendations?

What are your interests as well as movie genres you just are not interested in seeing, or movies that you feel would make you uncomfortable or wouldn't be appropriate for you so that I may give you a better recommendation?
Yes, I am actually open to anything as long as it isn't inappropriate, as in, anyone can see it. Widely available and easy to find. This is for adults that are 21 and over as well.

Perfect, I will be glad to assist you in finding a movie. Also, what kind of partner will be joining you in this viewing experience, so that I may tailor your experiences for the best recommendation, if I may ask?
Yes, this will be my wife. We love comedy, so something to that effect.
That sounds like a fun watching experience with your wife! I will definitely do my best! What streaming platforms do you currently have so that I may find something for you on that specific platform?
We prefer Netflix, as that is what we are mostly always using. We do have other platforms, but Netflix would be preferred.

I recommend Forgetting Sarah Marshall on Netflix. It is suitable for adults, with an IMDb rating for 7.1 and a popularity score of 1,950 and rising lately. I'll provide you with the IMDb page so you can have a little look for yourself. This movie is a fun and funny with how to turn a rough situation, like a break up, into a fun new experience of healing in another setting. I believe you and your wife will have a great time watching it. It has actors like Kristen Bell, Jason Segel and Paul Rudd, alongside Russell Brand and Jonah Hill. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0800039/

It also has a Rotten Tomatoes score of 83% https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/forgetting_sarah_marshall with very favorable reviews on the critics side and on the audience side.

Would this be okay for you and your wife? If not, I can look for something else, no problem!

That would be perfect! I just saw the links you provided and this definitely looks like something my wife and I would enjoy. We've actually been to Hawaii ourselves, which we noticed in the preview scene on the IMDb link you provided. We're also big Paul Rudd fans due to the Marvel movies and my wife LOVES Jason Segel movies.

That is great to hear! What aspects of the movie seem appealing to you and your wife? That sounds like such a nice place to visit, I am happy you told me you've been to Hawaii! Paul Rudd and Jason Segel are very good actors with a big skillset in both comedy and even serious acting roles, which make them very versatile, you are right on that!

The setting is definitely something we like as we are actually going on vacation ourselves soon for the holidays, so this just gets us more excited on the experiences and adventures we might run into.

I am so happy you shared that with me and were so open with your experiences with me. It was a pleasure helping you find a movie for you and your wife to recommend. I hope you have an amazing time on your vacation and I hope you enjoy the movie recommendation I provided. I will be more than happy to assist you again whenever you need me! Have a great viewing experience!
Thank you as well! I greatly appreciate all the help! Bye for now!
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hello. I want to watch a movie with my girlfriend this weekend.
That's a great idea. Are there any types of films or genres that you would prefer to avoid when watching a movie with you girlfriend?
She's a bit squeamish and doesn't like anything too gory.
And what sort of movies do you like watching most often?
I like dark thrillers and futuristic sci-fi stuff.
Do you have any favourite actors or directors you enjoy watching in those genres? And what about the time of year, would you enjoy something seasonal?
I like Ridley Scott and Christopher Nolan. Also, something with a Christmas theme would be spot-on.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1375666/. Inception is a brilliant movie that is both written and directed by Christopher Nolan. It's a futuristic sci-fi movie with lots of action. Although it doesn't have a particular Christmas theme, Christmas is a great time to watch great movies, and this is widely considered to be a great movie with a rating of 8.8/10 on IMDB (see link). This movie is also rated as 12A and isn't particularly gory. Let me know what you think.
That sounds good, I think that might work. Thanks
That's great. What is it about inception that appeals to you most for your movie night with your girlfriend?
It sounds like it ticks a lot of boxes and I think she might enjoy it too.
Thanks for chatting, I'm glad I could help. Have a great movie night!
Thanks
Hello. I'd like to watch another film directed or written by Christopher Nolan. Do you have any recommendations?
Certainly, I can help you with that. Would you prefer to watch the movie at home or elsewhere? And are there any specific types of movies that you would most like to watch?
I think I'd probably watch this one at home. I almost always enjoy dark thrillers and futuristic sci-fi movies the most.
What kind of mood are you feeling in right now and what streaming services do you have available to use? And will you be watching alone or with others?
I'm quite chill but would like some decent entertainment and I can use Netflix to stream. I'll be watching this one alone.

Interstellar is another movie directed by Christopher Nolan and written by Jonathan Nolan and Christopher Nolan. It's a futuristic Sci-fi movie with lots of adventure. Interstellar is available to watch on Netflix. https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/interstellar_2014. Interstellar seems a good fit for your preferences and the audience rating on Rotten Tomatoes (see link) is 86%, giving it an impressive score. Does this movie sound good to you?
Yes, it sounds really good to me.
And can I ask what in particular you like most about Christopher Nolan's films?

I like that he pushes the boundaries of filmmaking and creates very original work. I enjoy the concepts that he builds his films around and I think he uses time very creatively in a lot of his movies.
Thanks for sharing your insights. Enjoy the movie and have a great night.
Thanks
Hello. I'd like a movie recommendation please.
Hello! I'm happy to help you find a movie to watch. Are you planning to watch this movie alone or with other people? And do you have any genres or themes you'd prefer on this occasion?
I'd like to watch this movie over Christmas with my family. I usually prefer futuristic sci-fi and dark thrillers.
Do your family have any genre preferences and would they like anything in particular to suit the Christmas season?
They like engaging, action-packed movies. And it doesn't necessarily need to have a Christmas theme.
Do your family have any favourite genres? And are there any themes they prefer to avoid at Christmas?
They like crime dramas and are usually quite happy to watch any good movie over Christmas, regardless of theme.

The Dark Night is a film starring Christian Bale and Heath Ledger that is written and directed by Christopher Nolan. It's rated as 12A and has 9/10 on IMDB. The film also won 2 Oscars and is considered a top rated movie (see link). https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0468569/. This is a dark crime drama movie with lots of action that should keep you and your family entertained. Do you like the sound of this movie?
Yes, I think this movie sounds great.
And can I ask what it is that interests you in this movie please?
I like the director and the lead actors. I also think this fits the bill and will keep everyone happy and entertained.
I appreciate hearing your thoughts and may I wish you a pleasant time watching The Dark Knight with your family.
Thanks
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Thank you. I'm thinking of watching a movie with family, do you have any recommendations?
What is the age range of the family members you'll be watching the movie with?
Their ages range from 12 to 65.
What movie genre does your family most enjoy? What is your favourite movie in that genre?
We enjoy watching fantasy action movies and my favourite fantasy action movie is Lord of the Rings.
What do you enjoy most about fantasy action movies and why do you like Lord of the Rings in particular?
I love epic movies, with lots of characters and monsters, and Lord of the Rings has all of that.
What does your family enjoy most about fantasy action movies?
They like it when underdogs save the day and are particularly interested in fantasy action movies featuring children.

I recommend the classic 80s movie Willow. It's an epic fantasy adventure, with lots of action and exciting set pieces. It includes underdogs saving the day, it's regarded as a great movie for all the family, and features children. Here's an IMDB link - https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0096446/

What do you think of my suggestion and reasons?
That's a great recommendation. I have heard good things about Willow, but haven't seen it yet. I think it ticks all the boxes and my family will really enjoy it. Thank you.
Thank you for the kind words, I'm happy to be of help. Why do you think it ticks all the boxes for you and why do you think your family will enjoy it?
It seems like the kind of movie my family would really enjoy. It's an epic fantasy adventure with lots of exciting action andit's a tale of underdogs saving the day.
I'm really glad I could help. It's great that you feel the recommendation is strong. I hope you and your family enjoy the movie. Have fun!
Thanks!

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi! I am looking for a film that I can watch with my family. There are two adults and three children
Ok! I can help you with that. What genre of film would you like to watch (comedy, adventure etc) and do you have any restrictions such as violence or age?
An adventure would be good. The children are 12, 11 and 9 so nothing too violent and it would be good to have something fun for the adults too
So to confirm, an adventure film suitable for children under 12 but enjoyable for the whole family?
Yes

How about 'Jumanji: welcome to the jungle'. It is a certificate 12A and stars Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart. It's an action adventure with some comedic moments.

You can read more about the film and plot here https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2283362/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_3_nm_4_q_Jumanji%2520wel
Thank you - I will check the link now
You're welcome! It is rated 6.9 out of 10 on IMBD and comments suggest that it is fun for all the family!
That looks great - we will watch that :)
Fantastic! It would be great if you could let us know if you enjoyed the film. We can use this information to try help you find films in the future that are more suited to your tastes
Thank you - the reviews for this film look really good and we struggle to find films we all want to watch sometimes so I will definitely provide feedback
You're welcome! It helps us to help you. We hope you enjoy the film and have some fun family time together :)
End
I loved Jumanji! Can you give me suggestions of some other films with Dwayne Johnson in?

We're glad you enjoyed the film recommendation! Dwayne Johnson is a popular actor and has many different films. What genre of film are you interested in (comedy, adventure etc) and do you have any restrictions such as violence or age?

I enjoyed the adventure parts of Jumanji but it was funny in parts too. I think adventure, action or comedy. I am watching this alone so there are no age limitations. I don't mind some fight scenes but nothing too violent or gory.

From what you have told me I have a couple of suggestions. 
If you enjoyed 'Jumanji: welcome to the jungle' you may be interested to know there is a sequel 'Jumanji: the next level'. This is a 12A and follows on from the previous film with some new characters. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt7975244/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_9_prd

Another suggestion is 'Jungle Cruise'. This is a family friendly adventure film which stars Dwayne Johnson as the captain of a riverboat. As a group travel down the Amazon river they encounter many dangers and some supernatural goings on 
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0870154/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_8_prd
They both sound interesting! But I might save them for another night when the kids are around. Is there anything more adult?

If you enjoyed the action and comedy elements of Jumanji you may enjoy 'Red Notice' starring Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot and Ryan Reynolds. An unlikely pair must work together to try take down the world renowned art thief - the bishop. 
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt7991608/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_7_prd
It's rated 12A but the storyline is more suited to an older audience and there are action and fight scenes along with some comedy elements
Oh! I love Gal Gadot! That sounds great - I will definitely watch this
We will remember that you like Gal Gadot for future recommendations. Enjoy the film and please don't forget to rate it so we can make suggestions more suited to you in future
End
Conversation ended
End
done
done

users_mood: interested in adventure with some comedy
special_occasion: more adult content for a night without kids

dialogue.message: Hello, I am now thinking of hosting a movie watching party at my house with some friends next week.. Can you help suggest a movie for us to watch?
Hello, does your party have a particular theme you are interested in, what is likely to be the mood of everyone attending, and what streaming services do you have available?

My friends are likely to be in the mood for a movie we might consider a classic, something we all grew up watching. Something that gives us quotable lines and a sense of nostalgia. I have access to Netflix and Disney Plus
Would you and your friends be in the mood for a scary movie? Maybe something set in space? What streaming platforms do you have?
I will be in the mood to relax and so will my friends. I have access to Netflix and Disney Plus

Might I suggest you and your friends watch Aliens (1986)? This movie is available on Disney Plus, and is considered by many people to be a classic movie, especially among fans of science fiction or horror. It has many quotable lines and many people grew up watching this movie even as young children, which will give you and your friends a good dose of nostalgia and something to bond over. Does this suggestion work for you?

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0090605/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_8_nm_0_q_aliens
Yes! This is a great idea, I have not seen this movie in years! All of my friends love this movie and we can quote the movie as it plays
Can I ask what is it about Aliens (1986) that makes it an especially good choice? I would like to understand what makes this a great movie to watch with friends at a movie watching party

Aliens is one of the rare examples where the sequel outshines the original movie and is more remembered by people. It has some classic lines that people love to quote and characters that are memorable. The scene with the motion tracker and the Aliens approaching from within the ceiling is one of the most truly terrifying scenes in movie history
Thank you very much for your insight as to why Aliens (1986) is such a great movie! Have a great time with your friends in your movie watching party. Thank you for your time today
Thank you for your help

I am mostly interested in watching movies at home but I occasionally go to the theater. I am interested in finding another movie by the director of your last suggestion of The Taking of Deborah Logan
Are you only interested in work from that director or are there any other movies you've enjoyed that you would like to see other movies made from the same director?
I would be interested in seeing more movies from Adam Robitel but Ari Aster made my favorite movie of all time so Id love to see more of his work too.
Do you have any cultural or regional movie preferences and is there any specific actors or directors you enjoy or would like to avoid?
There isnt any actors or directors I would specifically like to avoid but I am not a big fan of horror comedies. But I would love to see more movies by Adam Robitel or Ari Aster.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt8772262/

Here is a suggestion for you. I have taken your dislike for horror comedy into account and chosen this movie due to your desire to see more work from Ari Aster. You also indicated another movie from him was your favorite horror movie of all time so it seemed like a great match. Do you have any feedback for this recommendation?
Looks good to me! I would be very excited to see another movie from him. I think that is a great recommendation.
Would you share what specific qualities or aspects of Ari Asters movies excites you?

My favorite aspects of his movies are how great and meaningful the stories are. Its uncommon in the horror genre and his movies seem to be some of the rare horror movies that are actually scary in any meaningful way.
Thank you so much for your lovely feedback! Have a great day.
Thanks again for the recommendation!

movie_like: Ari Aster's movies for great and meaningful stories

dialogue.message: Hello assistant. I am looking for a good movie to go watch at the theater with my girlfriend.
I would be glad to help! What are your girlfriends movie preferences? Is there any kind of theme or special occasion you would like taken into consideration?
Her favorite movie genre is horror just like me, but its almost Christmas and she loves Christmas movies too.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt15799866/
Here is a suggestion for you! 
I have chosen it due to its Christmas theme as well as your shared appreciation for horror movies. The movie is also in theaters right now nationwide. 
How would you rate this recommendation?
That seems like the perfect choice! That is a wonderful suggestion.
What would you say makes this choice the perfect choice for the both of you? Are there any specific qualities you both look for when watching a movie together?

I would say what makes it perfect is that its the best of both worlds. Blending horror with Christmas. I also appreciate that the suggestion took my girlfriend's fondness for Christmas movies into consideration. More generally the qualities we look for in a movie is for it to be the genre of horror and for it to have high audience reviews.
Thanks so much for your positive feedback! I hope you both enjoy your movie and have a great day.
Thanks again!
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hey there, I'm thinking of what movie I should watch tonight. It can be anything since I'll be watching by myself. Do you have any reccomendations?
I'm more than happy to help you find a movie you'll enjoy by yourself. Are there any specific genres or certain types of movies you prefer watching?
Well, since I don't need to worry about any one else I was thinking maybe a scary movie. I love watching horror movies when I'm by myself.
Horror movies gives me a great place to start from. What types of horror movies do you tend to enjoy? Ones that are more psychological, or perhaps your traditional Friday the 13th type of film?
I do love traditional horror but I'm thinking something with spirits or ghosts might be what I want tonight.
Perfect, I have a few ideas ready but let's make sure you'll have access to them. What streaming platforms do you have available to you?
I have access to Netflix and Hulu.

Perfect, I have just the thing for you. The movie is called Fear Street Part One 1994 and is available for you to view on Netflix. Since you said you like traditional horror films but are looking for something more related to ghosts or spirits, I think this one will be right up your alley. A small town is tormented by serial killers from the past commanded by a mysterious and evil force. Here is an IMDB link for it. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt6566576/
This looks pretty interesting, could you suggest to me another one? Also is there anything special abotu fear street that made you pick it?

Well, my reasoning for choosing Fear Street Part One 1994 was due to it focusing more on spirits while still maintaining a traditional horror story feel. Additionally, this is only one instalment in a 3-part series. With this in mind if you enjoy part one you have parts two and three to look forward to. Another movie I would be happy to recommend is Insidious. It has less of a traditional horror vibe and is more psychological but still centers around spirits and the afterlife. Insidious is also available on Netflix. Here is an IMDB link for it as well: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1591095/
Awesome, thank you so much for your suggestions!
You are very welcome and thank you for allowing me to provide movie recommendations for you! Thank you and have a wonderful and fright filled night!
You have a geed evening too!
Hey , that suggestion I got last time was perfect so I had to come back for another one!

That's wonderful to hear and I'm more than happy to help. Which movie did you end up watching, Insidious or Fear Street Part one 1994? Hopefully my next recommendation will be just as good. What would you be interested in watching today?
I watched the one that had 3 parts to it and I actually binged all 3! I was wondering if there might me any other movies starring one of the main girls in the movie. I believe her name was Kiana.
You must mean Kiana Madeira. Kiana has a few other movies that she both stars in and has smaller roles. Did you want to stick to the horror genre or move to a different one?
Yeah that's right, Kiana Madeira! I think since I'm so into horror I may as well stick to it. This time though, I want it to be more psychological
Psychological horror and featuring Kiana Madeira. Are you also going to be watching this alone?
This time I'll be watching with a friend of mine who's coming from out of town, they also like these types of films so no need to hold back!

Alright, I've got the perfect one for you then. Since you already watched all three parts of Fear Street, another horror movie she is featured in is Level 16. This movie fits with being more psychological and has some terrifying plot twists that you and your friend are sure to enjoy. This is also available on Netflix. Here is the IMDB link. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4006302

Oh, wow this looks really interesting. I can tell from the previews that it's going to be good. My friend is also really into having groups of people finding out something horrible about their situation and that's exactly what this is about. Great choice! Does she play a role in any other films in the same genre?

There is one other Kaina does play a role in another horror film but sadly this one is not available to you to view based on the platforms you have access to. Here is the link for it though in case you are interested. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt8569578. The movie is titled She never Died.
Well thank you for sharing that. I'm going to go ahead and check out Level 16. Thanks again for the help.
Thank you so much for allowing me to give you another recommendation. I hope this one turns out as good as the last one!
I hope so too, thanks again. goodbye!

companion_preferences_like: movies where groups of people find out something horrible about their situation

dialogue.message: I'm back again! You nailed it with that last suggestion as well, I'm here for another one!
That's great to hear! I'm really glad you enjoyed Level 16. What might you be looking for today?
Well I'll be watching a movie with my family this time.  I want to try something a little less traditional as well.
Alright, something less traditional. To clarify you would still like this to be related to horror?
Yes I would still like it to be a horror movie, but nothing too gory, my parents dont like that kind of stuff.

I think I have the perfect idea. There is a genre in horror where the movies are filmed directly from the point of view of a person or camera present in the setting. It's a good watch for a family into horror as it puts you all in the seats of the actors involved. The genre is loosely referred to as found footage. I think a good one to check out would be Creep. It's not gory but is more on the psychological side of things. Here is an IMDB link: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2428170
Hmm, I dont really think my parents would like that. Also it doesn't have to be tame as far as scary goes. I would like it to freak them out but not make them sick to their stomach.

Sorry that the last suggestion wasn't what you were looking for. Based on what you told me another movie I can suggest is Incantation. It is also in the found footage genre and is a lot more intense while not being overly gory. It is also a foreign film which you may find interesting. here is a link to the IMDB page: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt18968540
Oo, now this looks promising. And this is also available on netflix?
Incantation is indeed available on Netflix, what about it interests you?
I really like the old scary rituals involved as do my parents, they'll get a kick out of this. Thank you!
Not a problem and I'm glad I could help! I hope you and your family have a wonderful and scary night!
thank you, bye!
